column2: ILLINOIS DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Illinois
column6: IL

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When you see this sign, you should:
column4: move quickly toward the oncoming train.
column6: slow down and look for trains.
column8: look for a train station ahead.

column2: 2. Drivers have ________ to report a crash after it occurs.
column4: 90 minutes
column6: two hours
column8: 30 minutes

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: Hairpin corner ahead.
column6: Sharp right turn ahead.
column8: Warning: U-turn ahead.

column2: 4. What is the penalty for being convicted of illegally passing a stopped school bus?
column4: 30-day suspension of driving privileges.
column6: $100 fine and 7-day suspension of driving privileges.
column8: Your driver’s license or vehicle registration will be suspended for three months.

column2: 5. When you see this sign you should:
column4: merge left.
column6: turn right.
column8: watch for traffic to the right.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column6: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column8: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.

column2: 7. This is:
column4: a side road sign.
column6: a right curve sign.
column8: a merging traffic sign.

column2: 8. All drivers and passengers ages 8 and older must wear safety belts ______ the vehicle is equipped with air bags.
column4: even if
column6: only if
column8: unless

column2: 9. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column6: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 10. This road sign means the road you're driving on:
column4: turns to the right and then the left
column6: turns only to the left
column8: turns sharply to the left and then right

column2: 11. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column4: Young people.
column6: Drivers who are driving alone.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 12. You reach an intersection and you want to turn left. The light is green but oncoming traffic is heavy. You should:
column4: wait in the center of the intersection for traffic to clear.
column6: go to the next intersection.
column8: wait at the crosswalk for traffic to clear.

column2: 13. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column4: Pentagon
column6: Crossbuck
column8: Round

column2: 14. When two vehicles enter an intersection from different highways at the same time, which vehicle must yield the right-of-way?
column4: Either one.
column6: The vehicle on the left.
column8: The vehicle on the right.

column2: 15. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column6: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column8: take their foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 16. Green and white signs:
column4: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column6: give information about directions and distances.
column8: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.

column2: 17. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column6: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column8: Yes.

column2: 18. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.

column2: 19. The picture shows:
column4: a speeding fines doubled sign.
column6: a railroad advance warning sign.
column8: a reversible road sign.

column2: 20. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: to the pedestrian.
column6: by the pedestrian.
column8: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 21. Passengers under age __ must be secured in an appropriate child restraint system.
22. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: anticipate errors by other drivers.
column6: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column8: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

column2: 23. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: park in the zoo area.
column6: watch for this species crossing the road.
column8: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.

column2: 24. Your driver’s license may be revoked for:
column4: Driving under the influence of alcohol.
column6: Causing a crash in a construction zone.
column8: Alcohol test refusal.

column2: 25. This sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column8: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 26. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
column6: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column8: Listen to heavy metal music.

column2: 27. When being approached by an emergency vehicle using audible and visual signals, drivers must:
column4: immediately pull to the left side of the road and allow the emergency vehicle to pass.
column6: immediately come to a complete stop if possible.
column8: immediately pull to the right side of the road and allow the emergency vehicle to pass.

column2: 28. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column6: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.
column8: get out of your vehicle.

column2: 29. While driving you come upon a sign which says, “reduced speed 35 MPH”. You as a driver should know:
column4: that the new 35 MPH speed zone begins at the next “speed limit” sign.
column6: that the new 35 MPH speed zone begins at this sign.
column8: that the sign is put there to harass “good” drivers.

column2: 30. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It improves the vehicle stability.
column6: It improves the steering ability.
column8: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 31. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column4: hill
column6: soft shoulder
column8: no passing zone

column2: 32. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column6: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column8: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.

column2: 33. Bicyclists should travel to the left of faster moving traffic.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 34. You are waiting in the intersection to complete a left turn. You should:
column4: signal and keep your wheels straight.
column6: signal and keep your wheels turned to the left.
column8: not signal until you can complete your turn.

column2: 35. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column6: stop if necessary.
column8: None of the above.
